title: Why is Aatrox's early game gated so heavily when his mid and late are still lackluster?
body:
There is never a reason to take him over {{champion:59}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:39}} early, mid or late game. These 3 all have aspects of Aatrox's kit and all do everything that he does better. 

Why is Aatrox a Risk or Reward Champion with no Reward?
Why is Aatrox a Feast or Famine character who only Famines? 

low base stats
low base damage
low base stat growths
low base damage growths

forced to hurt himself and get really low to be killed just to have decent AS and Damage that isn't any higher than any other Fighter with damage and AS that isn't conditional. 

Is this all because he has a get out of jail free card? Drop the revive passive if its that strangling balance wise and give him a real kit. Pls.

replies.body: Likely because when it wasn't gated, he didn't die, then came back, and didn't die again. His revival passive on top of the massive amounts of health he can get back is keeping him down and stopping him from getting any real buffs.

And before those nerfs he was steamrolling people.

Aatrox's kit has too many inherent issues to be allowed to be powerful. He passively outsustains almost every champion in the game when below 50% health (60 (+75% bonus AD) every 3 attacks is an average of 20 (+25% bonus AD) per attack. At level 1. Holy shit.) so he's hard to punish. He's got a resurrection passive that guts his damage potential when he uses it. He's got costs based on maximum health so he's punished for building beef, but he also needs those costs to grant him AS so he's rewarded for building beef. He's got staggeringly poor scaling on his abilities, but he's supposed to be a melee carry.

I get the feeling Aatrox's design was changed a half dozen times in development, and what we've ended up with is a nonsensical mess of a champion with a kit that's constantly fighting itself and numerous archaic design choices that fit neither his theme nor his role. He needs his kit fixed before he can be allowed to be relevant, as right now he's either got the tankiness of a bruiser with the damage of a carry, or neither.

Seriously, there are so many times that I see an Aa thread and get excited, thinking that maybe just this once that he'll get some attention, in literally any way.

That's true, I remember a bunch of people thought his kit was boring, and really, it sort of is. It's a strange mismatched set consisting of abilities that are _very_ similar to others, such as the revive passive of Anivia/Zac, the knockup of someone like Malphite (although understandably less powerful), the three strike heal of Xin, the three strike extra damage of Jax, and other comparisons.

I'm the sort of person that likes theme more so than kit, most of the time. For instance, I think {{champion:68}} has a hilarious kit, one that I would probably really like, but the idea of a raccoon in a shite mech suit isn't exciting to me, making me not want to play him. With Aatrox I feel the opposite, his theme is amazing (Seriously, a Satan-looking bastard with a God of War background? Yes please), but his kit is lackluster.
Yeah, I'd love AAtrox to have a more war oriented kit, but that kind of rework would take a lot more time than Riot currently has.

Aatrox's sustain is quite a lot higher than those two.

Xin Zhao's starting heal on his W is pretty high, but Xin never levels his W first.  In fact, it's almost always leveled last.

Irelia's heal is about the same base value as Aatrox's - well, starts off quite a bit worse but scales up a little more, so they're about equal in base at level 5 ... except that Aatrox's comes with an AD ratio, and Irelia's doesn't have a ratio at all.

This is, of course, ignoring the double proc on Aatrox's heal that makes sure it's incredibly easy to sustain back above half health.

When Aatrox gets ahead, his sustain actually makes him insanely frustrating to play against.  I won't claim that getting ahead is the easiest thing in the world for him, and I won't say the guy doesn't have problems - but you've gotta be careful about buffing someone like that.

No, neither of them do. Irelia gets 5-26 every attack, so at the most she gets 78 every three attacks, but that's when she has the ability activated at level 5. Xin Zhao gets 30-50 every third auto with an ap ratio he'll never use while being traditionally built. Aatrox gets 20-40 with a 25% bonus AD ratio that triples when he's below 50% health so that becomes 60-120 with a 75% bonus ad ratio.

I think the low ratios are because he's meant to be an autoattacking carry, since the ratio on his Blood Price is actually not bad. However, the rest of his kit is pretty nonsensical: punished for building HP, but also needs HP to fill his passive and mitigate the cost of his Blood Price (which is flat); damage relies on AD, but Blood Price's cost scales with AD; has a revive passive but is useless after reviving; etc. At least his ult provides a way to fill his passive without paying % HP cost.
